If you are for gun control because you think it saves lives think again. This false hood has never been more evident than with the Massachusetts Bartley Fox laws enacted in the early 70's. Homicide rates dropped by approximately 32% after Bartley fox was enacted on the surface it looked like gun control works and this is what the public was lead to believe. Unless you had read the law and it's requirements, you would know that the opposite was true. 
 
 Before Bartley Fox there was only and FID (Firearms Identification Card) required to possess or buy a pistol. After Bartley Fox was the same except you needed at the least a letter from your chief of police (allowing you to buy and transport a pistol to your property and an F.I.D card or an LTC (Lic. to carry) a pistol. Bartley Fox required anyone who wanted to take a pistol off their property for what ever reason to have a LTC. Which allowed you to carry a gun concealed. Almost everyone who had a pistol at that time applied for the Lic. and got it. Since the law stated that if you applied for the Lic. the Lic. Authority shall issue the Lic. unless there were a legal reason such as felony etc. that prevented you from owning a gun. 
 
 In 1972 after Bartley Fox you all of a sudden had a massive influx of private citizens legality carrying concealed handguns. Surprise homicides dropped. The LTC. had a line on it that stated "Reason for Issue" this line filled out with one of two reasons 1. Hunting and Target or 2. Protection of Person and Property. The way that the law was written it made no difference what the lic. Said a LTC was an LTC and that was that.
 
 In the late 70's a lawsuit changed Bartley Fox. A citizen was arrested for having a loaded concealed handgun with an LTC that was for Hunting and Target. The arresting officer and DA thought that was wrong and procicuted the case and won, changing the law. After this Homicides rose to more than 1 a day in Mass. because most lic. at that point were for H&T. and also gave the Lic. Authority some control over the pistol owning public allowing them to issue, fulfilling the shall issue but controlling who actually carried for protection. So now they could actually prevent people from carrying a loaded handgun for protection. Before it didn't matter what the lic. Said now it did. H&T lic. were still allowed to carry the gun concealed only it had to be unloaded.
 
 In the late 80's the law changed again H&T and the protection reason for issue were replaced by the line All Lawful Purposes again the law went back to its origins. Again now anyone with the LTC was legal to carry a concealed handgun for protection and as before homicides dropped. And as before the LIC. Authority was left with no control.
 
 In the late 90's the laws changed once more changing shall issue to may issue. Again the lic. Authority again was able to control who could carry and who couldn't and guess what you got it homicides are again on the rise in MASS. Go figure..
 
 Conclusion: gun control kills....

 If you believe in gun control then you believe....
 
 That the more helpless you are the safer you are from criminals.
 
 That police and soldiers are the dregs of society who were unfit to get any real job, which perfectly qualifies them with the 
 high moral standards and keen intellect to handle these complicated tools and be our guardians.
 
 That police operate in groups with backup which is why they need larger capacity magazines than civilians who must face 
 criminals alone and therefore need less ammunition.
 
 That people don't need a gun for self defense because the police will protect them, when the Supreme Court has ruled on 1 occasion that "You, and only you, are responsible for your security and the security of your family and loved ones.", and on another occasion that "the police do not have a duty to protect you as an individual, but to protect society as a whole"  
 
 That Washington DC's low murder rate of 69 per 100,000 is due to gun control while Indianapolis' high murder rate of 9 per 100,000 is due to the lack of gun control.
 
 That an intruder will be incapacitated by tear gas or oven spray, but if shot with a .44 Magnum will get angry and kill you. 
 
 That the 2nd Amendment, ratified in 1787, allows the states to have National Guard, created by act of Congress in 1917.
 
 That guns are so complex to use that special training is necessary to use them properly, and so simple to use that they make murder easy. 
 
 That minimum sentences violate civil rights, unless it's for possessing a gun.
 
 That door-to-door searches for drugs are a gross violation of civil rights and a sign of fascism, but door-to-door searches for guns are a reasonable solution to the "gun problem".
 
 That laws that allow any government official from Governor to dogcatcher to carry a gun is reasonable, and the law that prohibits any private citizen from doing the same is a reasonable gun control measure.
 
 That free speech entitles one to own newspapers, transmitters, computers and typewriters, but self-defense only justifies bare hands.
 
 That the ready availability of guns today with only a few government forms, a waiting period and background checks, is responsible for all the school and mall shootings today compared to lack of school and mall shootings in the 1950's and 1960's, which was caused by the awkward availability of guns at any hardware store, gas station and by mail then.
 
 That a woman raped and murdered is morally superior to a woman with a smoking gun and a dead rapist at her feet.
 
 That the crime rate in America is decreasing because of gun control and and the increase in crimes requires more gun control.
 
 That statistics showing high murder rates justify gun control, and statistics that show increasing murder rates after gun control are "just statistics".
 
 That most people can't be trusted, so we should have more laws against guns, which most people will abide by because they can be trusted.
 
 That guns cause crime and kill people, which is why there are so many mass shootings at gun shows and gun shops.
 
 That a handgun, with up to 4 controls, is far too complex for the typical adult to learn to use, as opposed to an automobile that only has 20.

It seems like most of the arguments against gun control are based on cherry picked information. You never hear from gun advocates such things as Florida has been number 1 or 2 in violent crime ever since it passed its shall issue law. You never hear gun advocates pointing out that a pro-gun state like Utah has a higher rape rate than California and New York. They never tell you that in the decade preceding the Washington D.C. gun ban that D.C. had a higher homicide rate than in the decade that came after. As for Germany, gun ownership was legalized five years before Hitler came to power which doesn't exactly support the argument that gun ownership is a defense against tyranny. 
 
 Does gun-control work? That's like asking does medicine work. Medicine can work if it's the right kind and the right dosage. Gun control can work if it's strict enough and enforced enough. Unfortunately, the NRA likes to weaken gun laws with loopholes and makes them harder to enforce. Thus they make their claim "gun control doesn't work" a self fulfilling prophecy. The NRA likes to claim that the law abiding should be left alone and criminals should be punished. Then they do things like lobby Congress to reduce the budget of the ATF according to Bob Ricker, a former lawyer of the NRA who turned against the organization.

As for Germany, gun ownership was legalized five years before Hitler came to power, which doesn't exactly support the argument that gun ownership is a defense against tyranny.

The reason why gun control can never (repeat NEVER) work is because it's entire basis is built upon an impossible position: if you regulate the legal owners of guns then you'll manage to punish and regulate the illegal use of firearms by those that maliciously break the laws for personal gain. By applying this same strain of logic to other matters it's easy to see why it's illogal and impossible. 
 
 By this same logic the best way to stop people from catching the flu is to kill every last human being so nobody will ever get sick.
 
 By this same logic the best way to avoid another terrorist hijacking of airplanes is to ban all flight and order the destruction of all aircraft everywhere.
 
 By this same logic the best way to stop dogfighting is to outlaw dog ownership entirely.
 
 By this same logic the best way to stop the growth and cultivation or marijuana is to ban greenhouses and gardening centers because they grow plants.

Gun registration came with gun legalization. If you're trying to argue that the public was more armed in Germany before gun legalization than after then please present the evidence.

 
 Well if you're trying to make the argument that the Jewish population of Germany was actually armed at the time of them being rounded up like cattle, herded into the backs of trucks, relocated to the concentration camps and killed, then you'd better have some very good evidence to back up this claim.
 
 
My very next sentence was "Then they do things like lobby Congress to reduce the budget of the ATF..." 
 In other words, I was saying that if the ATF is underfunded then it will be harder for them to catch the criminals and thus it will less likely that criminals will be punished. I think that shows that I do not advocate leaving the criminals alone.

 
 Here's the thing. The ATF is currently overbudgeted and they're trying to justify their existance. What they're currently doing has almost absolutely nothing to do with fighting crime or catching criminals. They're doing two things currently: tracing guns for the police, and inspecting FFL dealers.
 
 Here's the thing about the second thing. The ATF has the authority to revoke a seller's license for paperwork errors. An example of a paperwork error that they can revoke a license for would be abbreviating your state of residence, such as putting AZ instead of Arizona, or if you put your social security number down with all 10 numbers together instead of hypenating them.
 
 Now you tell me this. Exactly what does that have to do with catching criminals? How does revoking a license do anything to the criminals that buy there, if the ATF isn't going after the registered buyers when they have all the information right there?

"A more farfetched question is the hypothetical proposition of armed Jewish resistance. First, they were not commonly armed even prior to the 1928 Law. Second, Jews had seen pogroms before and had survived them, though not without suffering. They would expect that this one would, as had the past ones, eventually subside and permit a return to normalcy. Many considered themselves 'patriotic Germans' for their service in the first World War. These simply were not people prepared to stage violent resistance. Nor were they alone in this mode of appeasement. The defiance of 'never again' is not so much a warning to potential oppressors as it is a challenge to Jews to reject the passive response to pogrom. Third, it hardly seems conceivable that armed resistance by Jews (or any other target group) would have led to any weakening of Nazi rule, let alone a full scale popular rebellion; on the contrary, it seems more likely it would have strengthened the support the Nazis already had. Their foul lies about Jewish perfidy would have been given a grain of substance. To project backward and speculate thus is to fail to learn the lesson history has so painfully provided."
 -N.A. Browne
